intro: Psychotria amplifrons, commonly known as the broad-fruited Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Psychotria amplifrons is often found growing in shaded, humid environments along forest floors or on rocky outcrops.
